body:
Get Outside Shoes: Your Complete Guide to Finding the Perfect Outdoor Footwear

Whether you're researching the popular Canadian retailer Get Outside Shoes or searching for the perfect outdoor footwear for your next adventure, this comprehensive guide covers everything you need to know. From hiking boots to trail runners, I'll share my personal experiences and expert insights to help you make the best footwear choices for your outdoor pursuits. Explore National Parks Store is your trusted resource for outdoor gear recommendations.

Table of Contents

  • What is Get Outside Shoes? (The Canadian Retailer)
  • Essential Types of Outdoor Footwear for Every Adventure
  • Top Outdoor Shoe Brands and Models You Need to Know
  • My Experience Shopping for Outdoor Footwear
  • How to Choose the Perfect Outdoor Shoes for Your Needs
  • Frequently Asked Questions
  • Conclusion

What is Get Outside Shoes? (The Canadian Retailer)

Get Outside Shoes has established itself as Toronto's premier destination for quality footwear since 1993, earning the reputation as the "Sole of the City." Located at 437 Queen Street W in Toronto's vibrant Entertainment District, this 100% Canadian online and brick-and-mortar retailer has been serving outdoor enthusiasts and fashion-conscious customers for over three decades. When I first discovered Get Outside Shoes through online research, I was impressed by their carefully curated selection of both classic and cutting-edge name-brand footwear.

The retailer specializes in premium brands including Red Wing Heritage boots, Birkenstock sandals, and other high-quality outdoor footwear options. Based on multiple Reddit discussions I've analyzed, customers consistently praise their authentic merchandise, competitive pricing, and reliable international shipping. One Reddit user specifically mentioned purchasing Red Wing 875 boots for approximately $190 USD shipped, which represents excellent value considering the usual retail price. This kind of deal highlights why savvy shoppers seek out outside shoes from this trusted Canadian source.

What sets Get Outside Shoes apart is their commitment to customer service and product authenticity. During my research, I found numerous positive customer experiences shared across social media platforms, with customers praising their same-day pickup service and knowledgeable staff recommendations. The store's Instagram presence showcases their diverse inventory and seasonal promotions, making it easy for customers to stay updated on the latest arrivals and special offers.

Their online shopping experience caters to both Canadian and international customers, with free shipping promotions frequently available. The store's website features detailed product descriptions and sizing guides, which proves essential when shopping for outdoor footwear online. For anyone looking to get outside shoes from a reputable retailer with decades of experience, this Toronto institution represents an excellent choice for quality and reliability.

Essential Types of Outdoor Footwear for Every Adventure

Understanding the different categories of outdoor footwear is crucial for making informed purchasing decisions. Throughout my years of hiking, backpacking, and outdoor exploration, I've learned that having the right type of shoe for specific activities can make the difference between an enjoyable adventure and a miserable experience. Let me break down the essential categories that every outdoor enthusiast should understand.

Hiking Boots: Maximum Support and Protection

Traditional hiking boots remain the gold standard for serious backpackers and those tackling challenging terrain. These high-cut shoes provide superior ankle support, protection from rocks and debris, and exceptional durability for multi-day adventures. During my recent backpacking trip through Olympic National Park, my mid-cut hiking boots proved invaluable on the rugged Sol Duc trail, preventing ankle injuries on loose rock sections.

Modern hiking boots feature advanced materials like Gore-Tex waterproofing, Vibram outsoles for traction, and improved cushioning systems. Brands like Salomon, Merrell, and La Sportiva have revolutionized boot construction, reducing break-in time while maintaining durability. When you need to get outside boots for serious hiking, investing in quality construction pays dividends in comfort and longevity.

Trail Running Shoes: Speed and Agility

Trail runners have gained massive popularity among hikers seeking lighter, more agile footwear. These low-cut shoes excel on well-maintained trails and day hikes, offering superior breathability and faster drying times compared to traditional boots. My personal favorite for summer hiking is the Altra Lone Peak series, which provides excellent grip and zero-drop design for natural foot positioning.

The key advantages of trail runners include reduced weight, faster break-in periods, and enhanced ground feel for better balance on technical terrain. However, they sacrifice some protection and durability compared to full hiking boots. For those interested in best running shoes for outside activities, trail runners represent the perfect compromise between performance and comfort.

ü•æ Shop Premium Hiking Boots on Amazon

Top Outdoor Shoe Brands and Models You Need to Know

After testing dozens of outdoor shoe models across various terrains and conditions, I've identified the brands and specific models that consistently deliver exceptional performance. These recommendations are based on my personal experience combined with extensive research into customer reviews, professional gear testing, and industry reputation.

Merrell: The Industry Standard

The Merrell Moab series stands as the best-selling hiking shoe line in history, and for good reason. During my extensive field testing, the Moab 3 consistently impressed with its balanced combination of comfort, durability, and affordability. The acronym "MOAB" stands for "Mother of All Boots," reflecting the brand's confidence in this flagship model. I've personally logged over 300 miles in various Moab iterations across desert, forest, and alpine environments.

What makes Merrell exceptional is their focus on all-day comfort without sacrificing performance. The Vibram outsoles provide reliable traction, while the air cushion heel absorbs shock effectively. The latest Moab 3 features improved breathability and updated styling while maintaining the durability that made previous generations famous. For hikers seeking best shoes for walking outside, the Moab series represents an excellent starting point.

üèîÔ∏è Get Merrell Hiking Boots on Amazon

Altra: Zero-Drop Innovation

Altra has revolutionized the outdoor footwear industry with their zero-drop platform and FootShape toe box design. The Lone Peak series, in particular, has gained a cult following among thru-hikers and ultralight backpackers. My experience with the Lone Peak 8 on the John Muir Trail revealed why this shoe has become the unofficial footwear of choice for serious distance hikers.

The zero-drop design promotes natural foot positioning and can help reduce common hiking injuries like plantar fasciitis and knee pain. However, the transition from traditional shoes requires a gradual break-in period to allow your feet and legs to adapt. The wide toe box accommodates foot swelling during long hikes, while the minimal cushioning provides excellent ground feel for technical terrain navigation.

User Review Analysis

Based on my analysis of customer feedback across Amazon, Reddit, and outdoor forums, here are three representative user experiences that highlight key considerations:

Amazon Review Summary - Merrell Moab 3: "After 200 miles of desert hiking in Arizona, these shoes show minimal wear and maintained comfort throughout. The sizing runs true, and the grip on slickrock is excellent. My only complaint is they take a while to dry after stream crossings." - Verified Purchase, 4.5/5 stars

Reddit Review Summary - Altra Lone Peak: "Switched from boots to these for my PCT section hike. The zero-drop took some getting used to, but now I can't imagine hiking in anything else. Wide toe box prevented all the toe issues I had with narrow boots. Durability is decent for the weight." - r/Ultralight community member

Outdoor Forum Review - La Sportiva Wildcats: "These excel on technical terrain where precision matters. The aggressive tread and sticky rubber provide confidence on exposed rock. They're not the most comfortable for long road walks, but for scrambling and mixed terrain, they're unbeatable." - Backpacker Magazine forum contributor

My Experience Shopping for Outdoor Footwear

Over fifteen years of serious hiking and backpacking has taught me invaluable lessons about choosing the right outdoor footwear. My journey began with poorly fitted big-box store boots that caused blisters and hot spots on my first multi-day backpacking trip in the Cascade Mountains. That painful experience motivated me to become a more educated consumer and eventually led me to discover specialized retailers like Get Outside Shoes.

One of my most memorable footwear discoveries happened during a visit to Vancouver, where I stumbled upon Get Outside Shoes' reputation through local hiking forums. Several experienced hikers recommended the store for authentic Red Wing boots, which sparked my interest in exploring their online offerings. The competitive pricing and Canadian exchange rates made it an attractive option for high-quality footwear purchases.

Lessons Learned from Real-World Testing

My most valuable education came through trial and error across diverse terrain and weather conditions. During a challenging section hike of the Appalachian Trail through Vermont's Green Mountains, I learned the critical importance of waterproof footwear after spending three days with constantly wet feet. This experience led me to invest in Gore-Tex boots for future wet-weather adventures.

Conversely, a summer hiking trip through Utah's desert canyons taught me that waterproof shoes can become uncomfortably hot and sweaty in arid conditions. The breathability trade-off became apparent when my feet developed hot spots from excessive moisture retention. This experience reinforced the importance of matching footwear to specific environmental conditions rather than relying on one-size-fits-all solutions.

My most recent gear upgrade involved transitioning to trail runners for most day hikes and light backpacking. The decision came after consulting with a ranger at Olympic National Park who recommended lighter footwear for the well-maintained trail system. The weight reduction and increased comfort were immediately noticeable, though I still prefer boots for off-trail exploration and heavy pack loads.

üå≤ Discover Trail Running Shoes

Seasonal Footwear Strategy

Living in the Pacific Northwest has taught me the importance of seasonal footwear rotation. Spring hiking requires shoes that can handle muddy conditions and frequent stream crossings, making waterproof models essential. My go-to spring setup includes mid-cut waterproof boots paired with merino wool socks for warmth and moisture management.

Summer hiking allows for maximum breathability and lighter construction. I typically switch to low-cut trail runners or hiking shoes with mesh panels for improved airflow. The reduced ankle support requires more careful foot placement on technical terrain, but the comfort and temperature benefits make this trade-off worthwhile for most day hikes.

Fall and winter hiking present unique challenges that require insulated and waterproof solutions. My winter footwear strategy involves layering systems with moisture-wicking liner socks beneath insulating wool socks, paired with insulated boots rated for the expected temperature range. For those looking to boots outside during harsh weather conditions, proper insulation becomes absolutely critical for safety and comfort.

How to Choose the Perfect Outdoor Shoes for Your Needs

Selecting the perfect outdoor footwear requires careful consideration of multiple factors including terrain, climate, activity type, and personal biomechanics. After years of testing various shoes across different conditions, I've developed a systematic approach that helps eliminate costly mistakes and ensures optimal performance for specific use cases.

Terrain-Specific Considerations

Desert hiking demands different footwear characteristics than alpine adventures or forest trails. In sandy environments, I prefer shoes with protective rand features and breathable uppers to prevent debris infiltration while maintaining temperature control. My experience hiking through Arizona's Superstition Mountains taught me the value of light-colored shoes that reflect heat and reduce internal temperatures.

Rocky, technical terrain requires shoes with aggressive tread patterns and protective toe caps. The La Sportiva Wildcat serves as my go-to choice for scrambling sections where precision footwork is essential. The sticky rubber compound provides confidence on exposed rock, while the rigid construction protects against sharp edges and impacts.

Muddy, wet conditions call for self-cleaning tread designs and waterproof construction. During spring hiking season in the Cascades, I rely on shoes with deep, widely spaced lugs that shed mud effectively and maintain traction on slippery surfaces. The Salomon X Ultra series excels in these conditions with their aggressive Contagrip outsoles.

Activity-Specific Recommendations

Day hiking allows for lighter, more comfortable footwear options since you're not carrying heavy overnight gear. Trail runners or light hiking shoes provide adequate support for most maintained trails while maximizing comfort and reducing fatigue. For casual walkers seeking shoes for outside activities, this category offers the best balance of performance and versatility.

Backpacking with heavy loads requires additional ankle support and durable construction to handle extended use. Full-height boots become more important when carrying 30+ pound packs, as the additional weight stresses foot and ankle structures differently. My experience on the John Muir Trail with a 40-pound pack confirmed the value of sturdy boots for load-bearing comfort.

Trail running demands specialized shoes optimized for speed and agility rather than maximum protection. These shoes prioritize lightweight construction, responsive cushioning, and secure fit over durability and weather protection. For athletes interested in best shoes for running outside women's specific models, factors like heel-to-toe drop and midsole firmness become critical considerations.

Pros and Cons of Popular Outdoor Shoe Categories

Hiking Boots Pros: Maximum ankle support, excellent protection, superior durability for heavy use, waterproof options widely available

Hiking Boots Cons: Heavier weight, longer break-in period, reduced breathability, higher cost

Trail Runners Pros: Lightweight design, immediate comfort, excellent breathability, faster drying times

Trail Runners Cons: Limited ankle support, reduced durability, less protection from debris

Specialized Use Cases

Some activities require highly specialized footwear that differs significantly from standard hiking shoes. For basketball players who need to best shoes to play basketball outside on outdoor courts, considerations like court grip and lateral support become paramount over traditional hiking features.

Similarly, those interested in activity outside pursuits that don't involve hiking may benefit from crossover shoes that blend outdoor capabilities with urban styling. These versatile options work well for travel situations where you need one pair of shoes for multiple activities.

‚ùÑÔ∏è Shop Winter Outdoor Boots

Frequently Asked Questions

Is Get Outside Shoes a legitimate retailer?

Yes, Get Outside Shoes is a legitimate Canadian footwear retailer that has been serving Toronto since 1993. Based on my research and customer reviews, they offer authentic brand-name footwear including Red Wing, Birkenstock, and other premium outdoor brands. Multiple Reddit users have confirmed positive shopping experiences, with reliable shipping to both Canada and the US. The store operates both online and has a physical location at 437 Queen Street W in Toronto. Their reputation for competitive pricing and authentic merchandise makes them a trusted source for quality outdoor footwear.

What's the difference between hiking boots and trail runners?

Hiking boots provide superior ankle support, durability, and protection for challenging terrain and heavy loads. They're ideal for multi-day backpacking and rocky trails. Trail runners are lighter, more flexible, and offer better breathability for day hikes and well-maintained trails. From my experience hiking in both types, trail runners excel in speed and comfort on moderate terrain, while boots are essential for technical trails and when carrying heavy packs. Consider your specific hiking style and terrain when choosing between these options for your outdoor adventures.

How do I choose the right size for outdoor shoes?

Proper sizing for outdoor shoes requires measuring both feet in the afternoon when they're naturally swollen. I recommend going up a half size from your regular shoe size to account for toe swelling during long hikes and thicker hiking socks. Always try shoes on with the socks you'll actually wear hiking. Walk around the store on inclined surfaces if possible, and ensure there's thumb-width space between your longest toe and the shoe front to prevent black toenails on descents. This sizing approach has prevented foot problems during my long-distance hiking experiences.

Are waterproof shoes worth the extra cost?

Waterproof shoes are valuable for specific conditions but come with trade-offs. They excel in wet, muddy conditions and stream crossings, keeping feet dry in light rain and snow. However, they're less breathable and take longer to dry if water gets inside. Based on my hiking experience in Pacific Northwest trails, I find waterproof shoes essential for winter hiking and muddy spring conditions, but prefer breathable shoes for summer desert hiking. Consider your typical hiking environment and season when deciding whether waterproof features justify the additional cost and reduced breathability.

What outdoor shoe brands offer the best value?

For value-conscious hikers, I recommend Merrell Moab series for reliable all-around performance, Altra Lone Peak for zero-drop enthusiasts, and Columbia for budget-friendly options. Mid-range brands like Salomon and Keen offer excellent durability-to-price ratios. Premium brands like La Sportiva and Scarpa provide superior performance for technical terrain but at higher costs. Based on my gear testing experience, the Merrell Moab 3 offers the best combination of comfort, durability, and affordability for most recreational hikers, typically lasting 400-600 miles of moderate use before requiring replacement.

üëü Browse Outdoor Shoe Collection

Conclusion

Finding the perfect outdoor footwear is a journey that requires understanding your specific needs, terrain requirements, and activity goals. Whether you're shopping at the reputable Get Outside Shoes retailer in Toronto or exploring other options, the key is matching footwear characteristics to your intended use. My fifteen years of hiking experience has taught me that there's no single perfect shoe for every situation, but understanding the trade-offs helps you make informed decisions.

The outdoor footwear industry continues evolving with new materials, construction techniques, and design philosophies. From traditional leather boots to modern synthetic trail runners, each category serves specific purposes and user preferences. The rise of retailers like Get Outside Shoes demonstrates the importance of specialized knowledge and customer service in helping outdoor enthusiasts find their ideal footwear solutions.

Remember that the best outdoor shoes are the ones that fit your feet properly, match your intended activities, and inspire confidence on the trail. Invest in quality construction from reputable brands, take time for proper fitting, and don't hesitate to consult experienced retailers or fellow hikers for recommendations. For those ready to get outside adventures started, proper footwear represents the foundation for safe, comfortable outdoor experiences.

Whether you choose hiking boots, trail runners, or specialized outdoor shoes, prioritize fit, function, and quality over trends or price alone. Your feet carry you through countless adventures, and investing in their comfort and protection pays dividends in enjoyment and safety. Start with one quality pair that matches your primary activities, then build your footwear collection as your outdoor interests expand and evolve. For additional outdoor gear recommendations and adventure planning resources, visit Explore National Parks Store for expert guidance and curated product selections.

The journey to find your perfect outdoor shoes may involve some trial and error, but the process itself is part of becoming a more knowledgeable and prepared outdoor enthusiast. Whether you're planning your first day hike or preparing for a multi-week expedition, the right footwear will enhance your experience and create lasting memories on the trail.

Ready to find your perfect outdoor shoes? Visit Explore National Parks Store for more outdoor gear guides and expert recommendations.
